variant.question: The average temperature of an air mass is ISA -10°C. Determine the vertical distance between FL70 and FL40:

The following temperatures have been observed over a station at 12:00 UTC. Assume the station is at MSL.

| **Height** |  | **Temperature** |    |
| ---------- |  | --------------- | -- |
| 20 000 ft  |  | \-12            | °C |
| 18 000 ft  |  | \-11            | °C |
| 16 000 ft  |  | \-10            | °C |
| 14 000 ft  |  | \-10            | °C |
| 12 000 ft  |  | \-6             | °C |
| 10 000 ft  |  | \-2             | °C |
| 8 000 ft   |  | +2              | °C |
| 6 000 ft   |  | +6              | °C |
| 4 000 ft   |  | +12             | °C |
| 2 000 ft   |  | +15             | °C |
| surface    |  | +15             | °C |

options.text: Assuming that the MSL pressure is 1 013.25 hPa the true altitude of an aircraft would actually be higher than the indicated altitude.
The layer between 16 000 and 18 000 ft is absolutely unstable.
The height of the freezing level over the station is approximately 12 000 ft.
The temperature at 10 000 ft is in agreement with the temperature in the International Standard Atmosphere.
